content:
I'm liking how Midcamp is gathering session ideas for their unconference. It's really basic, but nice. It's not clear to me if it's any more successful than our own method, but it's giving me ideas for next time.

We should all crash Midcamp and learn from them.

Take a look at this page. I encourage you to look at both the "submit an idea" form AND the "see what's been submitted" ideas.

https://www.midcamp.org/2021/schedule

Schedule | MidCamp 2021
Wednesday, March 24: Get Started with Drupal. We'll have a morning of sessions to introduce attendees to Drupal and workshops in the afternoon to get you prepared for the rest of camp.

We should all crash Midcamp and learn from them.

I thought the same :sweat_smile: ...we should propose a session between the MidCamp event organizers and the organizers for our events, to get together and specifically discuss these sorts of things and exchange ideas/experiences.
I proposed a session on managing online events, meetings, and conferences - which would serve that purpose.
@klonos - It is a good idea.
Great minds ... :wink:

Really liking what I am seeing on the Midcamp site.
https://www.midcamp.org/2021/article/community-onboarding-day-new-virtual-welcome-table

Community Onboarding Day: A new virtual “welcome table” | MidCamp 2021
Edit: After publishing, and based on community feedback, we've modified our naming slightly. "Community Day" is now "Community Onboarding Day".

To encourage diversity in discussions, we’ll also be holding a workshop for marginalized, underrepresented, and historically excluded speakers on Wednesday afternoon.

Do D7 site owners fit in this group, since there are practically no sessions about D7 any more in Drupal events, and anything related to D7 is being treated as EoL before it actually is? (and while 70-60% of the Drupal sites out there are still on D7)
...and "how to upgrade your D7 site to D8/9" sessions do not count :stuck_out_tongue:

I would say "yes" @klonos

A discussion called "How to stay on Drupal 7 and love it!" would be a pretty enticing title. It's click baity but that's marketing for ya :wink:
Or "How to give D7's EOL the proverbial finger" :wink:
It's an unconference, so anyone can nominate any of these ideas. I like "How to stay on Drupal 7 and love it!"
